Stefan Denker wrote:
> On Thu, Feb 18, 2010 at 01:45:03PM +0100, I wrote:
>>> Heritrix 3 is supposed to have some new facilities for this, although
>>> I haven't familiarized myself with them yet.
>>> I'd suggest you start here: https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Deduplication+Reduction+Processors
>>> Some of those features may be in Heritrix 2 
>> They are. :-) Well, The classes are. I will see if they are useable to
>> me. 
> 
> Ok, after some Testing: The modules are buggy, but I was able to fix
> them. The bug:  As both PersistLoadProcessor and PersistStoreProcessor
> inherit from PersistOnlineProcessor, they both try to open a database,
> in my case the very same one. This yields to an Exception in the
> BDBModule. Fixed by allowing access if the BDBConfig is the same in all
> Parameters. 
> PersistOnlineProcessor also closes the Database, leading to an Exception
> when the second Processor in Chain tries to close it. Fixed by
> now relying on BDBModule to close the database. 
> 
> Please keep in mind that this is Heritrix 2, NOT 3. Is there still some
> maintenance for Heritrix 2? Are patches for it welcome?

Hi, Stefan.

We encourage people who have the skill to deal with its Spring/XML-based 
configuration to move to H3. In particular, in H3 the 'load' and 'store' 
processors can easily share the same BdbModule, similar to the fix 
you've described.

(The assumption prior to H3 was that they would each consult distinct 
environments -- no necessarily a *good* assumption, but the way early 
development/examples of that functionality worked.)

We would welcome a tested patch for H2, but even if committed to H2's 
source branch, a future H2 patch release is less likely than further 
improvements on H3.

- Gordon @ IA
